comments: a(n) is also the coefficient of x^(n-1) in the bivariate Fibonacci polynomials F(n)(x,y)=xF(n-1)(x,y)+yF(n-2)(x,y),F(0)(x,y)=0,F(1)(x,y)=1, when we write 13x for x and -36x^2 for y. - Mario Catalani (mario.catalani(AT)unito.it), Dec 09 2002
links: R. Fl√≥rez, R. A. Higuita, A. Mukherjee, Alternating Sums in the Hosoya Polynomial Triangle, Article 14.9.5 Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 17 (2014).
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (13, -36).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
